intro: Sium tenuifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved water pepper, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant has slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are white or pale purple, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, rounded fruits. It typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes and stream banks.
